warzone.service

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • warzone.service.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class GameEngine
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Main game loop. Loop over each player for the assign reinforcements, issue orders, and execute orders main game loop phases
    See Also:

      • start

        public void start()
        This method will ask the user: 1. What part of the game they want to start with (edit map or play game). Depending on the choice, the state will be set to a different object, which will set different behavior. 2. What command they want to execute from the game. Depending on the state of the GameEngine, each command will potentially have a different behavior.

      • isReadyToStart

        public boolean isReadyToStart()
        This method will show whether the game can start.
        Returns:
        true if the game can start

      • play

        public boolean play()
        If the game turn is greater than 100, the game will end.
        Returns:
        true if the game can end.

      • isGameEnded

        public boolean isGameEnded()
        This method will determine if the game whether can end.
        Returns:
        true if the current state satisfy the end condition: 1. there is just one player left 2. the number of game turn is greater than 100.

      • isGameEnded

        public boolean isGameEnded(boolean isShowResult)
        This method will determine if the game whether can end.
        Parameters:
        isShowResult - is show result
        Returns:
        true if the current state satisfy the end condition: 1. there is just one player left 2. the number of game turn is greater than 100.

      • assignReinforcements

      • addCardsForAllAlivePlayers

        public void addCardsForAllAlivePlayers()
        add card for all Alive players

      • issueOrders

        public void issueOrders()
        The GameEngine class calls the issue_order() method of the Player. This method will wait for the following command, then create a deploy order object on the players list of orders, then reduce the number of armies in the players reinforcement pool. The game engine does this for all players in round-robin fashion until all the players have placed all their reinforcement armies on the map.

      • executeOrders

        public void executeOrders()
        The GameEngine calls the next_order() method of the Player. Then the Order objectï¿½s execute() method is called which will enact the order.
        1. get the max number of the orders own by a single player
        2. excute the orders from player's order list in round-robin fashion

      • assignCards

        public void assignCards()
        This method will assign a random card to each player that conquered a country this turn

        public void reboot()
        reboot the game

            throws FileNotFoundException

        Parameters:
        p_fileName - given file name
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - exception of file not found
